text: John L. Gilbert III (born July 13, 1928) is an American television personality and actor. He worked mainly on television game shows. He was a nightclub singer and entertainer before becoming an announced for television game shows. He is known for his work as the announcer and audience host for the syndicated version of the quiz show Jeopardy! since its revival in 1984. Gilbert was born in Newport News, Virginia. In 2017 Gilbert was honored by the Guinness Book of World Records for having the longest career as a game show announcer for a single show, after 32 years with Jeopardy. ==References== ==Other websites== * *Johnny Gilbert's bio on the Jeopardy! website * Category:1928 births Category:Living people Category:American television personalities Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:American stage actors Category:Actors from Virginia Category:Singers from Virginia
title: Johnny Gilbert
